Blood type has nothing to do with who will form a relationship or get married,...
...pulling the rug from under one of the odd Korean superstitions that many have faith in.
The Korea Marriage Culture Institute, a division of matchmaker Sunoo,...
...studied 16,383 couples - 1,366 of them married over the five years since 2001...
...and found that the distribution of blood types among men the women married...
...or had relationships with was about equal.
Interestingly, the combination rumored to spell doom...
...-type A woman and type B man - was in fact the most fortuitous.
The margin of error in this study was low.
